fixes.name: Notional Amount T
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR useCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR paramEndDate = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As])
RETURN
IF(
    useCustom,
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Max Date Exclude] = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE],
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[NOTIONAL_AMOUNT],
        0
    ),
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE] = paramEndDate,
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[NOTIONAL_AMOUNT],
        0
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF logic to DAX using SELECTEDVALUE for parameters and explicit table column references. Parameter [Parameters].[Use Custom Date] -> SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As]) and [Parameters].[End Date] -> SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As]). All field references were converted to 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[FieldName]. Used VARs for parameter values and an IF/IF structure to mirror the nested IFs from Tableau.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau calculation references parameters ([Parameters].[Use Custom Date] and [Parameters].[End Date]); per rules, any calculation using parameters must be created as a measure.
